segments.en: Linked Discourses 6
1. The Appeal
5. A Certain Brahmā
At Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa brahmuno evarūpaṃ pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ hoti:
segments.en: Now at that time a certain Brahmā had the following harmful misconception:

segments.pli: “natthi so samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā yo idha āgaccheyyā”ti.
segments.en: “No ascetic or brahmin can come here!”

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā tassa brahmuno cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya—seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso … pe … tasmiṃ brahmaloke pāturahosi.
segments.en: Then the Buddha knew what that Brahmā was thinking. As easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm, he vanished from Jeta’s Grove and reappeared in that Brahmā realm.

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā tassa brahmuno upari vehāsaṃ pallaṅkena nisīdi tejodhātuṃ samāpajjitvā.
segments.en: Then the Buddha sat cross-legged in the air above that Brahmā, having entered upon the fire element.
Then Venerable Mahāmoggallāna thought,
“Where is the Buddha staying at present?”

segments.pli: Addasā kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno bhagavantaṃ dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena tassa brahmuno upari vehāsaṃ pallaṅkena nisinnaṃ tejodhātuṃ samāpannaṃ.
segments.en: With clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, he saw the Buddha seated cross-legged in the air above that Brahmā, having entered upon the fire element.

segments.pli: Disvāna—seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṃ vā bāhaṃ pasāreyya, pasāritaṃ vā bāhaṃ samiñjeyya; evameva—jetavane antarahito tasmiṃ brahmaloke pāturahosi.
segments.en: Then, as easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm, he vanished from Jeta’s Grove and reappeared in that Brahmā realm.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno puratthimaṃ disaṃ nissāya tassa brahmuno upari vehāsaṃ pallaṅkena nisīdi tejodhātuṃ samāpajjitvā nīcataraṃ bhagavato.
segments.en: Then Mahāmoggallāna—positioning himself in the east, below the Buddha—sat cross-legged in the air above that Brahmā, having entered upon the fire element.
Then Venerable Mahākassapa …

segments.pli: Addasā kho āyasmā mahākassapo bhagavantaṃ dibbena cakkhunā … pe …
disvāna—seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso … pe … evameva—jetavane antarahito tasmiṃ brahmaloke pāturahosi.
Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo dakkhiṇaṃ disaṃ nissāya tassa brahmuno upari vehāsaṃ pallaṅkena nisīdi tejodhātuṃ samāpajjitvā nīcataraṃ bhagavato.
segments.en: positioned himself in the south …
Venerable Mahākappina …

segments.pli: Addasā kho āyasmā mahākappino bhagavantaṃ dibbena cakkhunā … pe … tejodhātuṃ samāpannaṃ.
Atha kho āyasmā mahākappino pacchimaṃ disaṃ nissāya tassa brahmuno upari vehāsaṃ pallaṅkena nisīdi tejodhātuṃ samāpajjitvā nīcataraṃ bhagavato.
segments.en: positioned himself in the west …
Venerable Anuruddha …

segments.pli: Addasā kho āyasmā anuruddho … pe … tejodhātuṃ samāpannaṃ.
Disvāna—seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso … pe … tasmiṃ brahmaloke pāturahosi.
Atha kho āyasmā anuruddho uttaraṃ disaṃ nissāya tassa brahmuno upari vehāsaṃ pallaṅkena nisīdi tejodhātuṃ samāpajjitvā nīcataraṃ bhagavato.
segments.en: positioned himself in the north, below the Buddha, sitting cross-legged in the air above that Brahmā, having entered upon the fire element.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno taṃ brahmānaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi:
segments.en: Then Mahāmoggallāna addressed that Brahmā in verse:
“Sir, do you still have the same view
that you had in the past?
Or do you see the radiance
transcending the Brahmā realm?”
“Good sir, I don’t have that view
that I had in the past.
I see the radiance
transcending the Brahmā realm.
So how could I say today
that I am permanent and eternal?”

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā taṃ brahmānaṃ saṃvejetvā—seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṃ vā bāhaṃ pasāreyya, pasāritaṃ vā bāhaṃ samiñjeyya; evameva—tasmiṃ brahmaloke antarahito jetavane pāturahosi.
segments.en: Having inspired a sense of awe in the Brahmā, as easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm, the Buddha vanished from the Brahmā realm and reappeared in Jeta’s Grove.

segments.pli: Atha kho so brahmā aññataraṃ brahmapārisajjaṃ āmantesi:
segments.en: Then that Brahmā addressed a member of his retinue,

segments.pli: “ehi tvaṃ, mārisa, yenāyasmā mahāmoggallāno tenupasaṅkama; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ mahāmoggallānaṃ evaṃ vadehi:
segments.en: “Please, good sir, go up to Venerable Mahāmoggallāna and say to him:

segments.pli: ‘atthi nu kho, mārisa moggallāna, aññepi tassa bhagavato sāvakā evaṃmahiddhikā evaṃmahānubhāvā;
segments.en: ‘Moggallāna my good sir, are there any other disciples of the Buddha who have power and might

segments.pli: seyyathāpi bhavaṃ moggallāno kassapo kappino anuruddho’”ti?
segments.en: comparable to the masters Moggallāna, Kassapa, Kappina, and Anuruddha?’”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, mārisā”ti kho so brahmapārisajjo tassa brahmuno paṭissutvā yenāyasmā mahāmoggallāno tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ mahāmoggallānaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: “Yes, good sir,” replied that retinue member. He went to Moggallāna and asked as instructed.

segments.pli: “atthi nu kho, mārisa moggallāna, aññepi tassa bhagavato sāvakā evaṃmahiddhikā evaṃmahānubhāvā;
seyyathāpi bhavaṃ moggallāno kassapo kappino anuruddho”ti?
Atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno taṃ brahmapārisajjaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi:
segments.en: Then Mahāmoggallāna addressed that member of Brahmā’s retinue in verse:
“There are many disciples of the Buddha
who have the three knowledges,
and have attained psychic power, expert in reading minds,
they’re perfected ones with defilements ended.”

segments.pli: Atha kho so brahmapārisajjo āyasmato mahāmoggallānassa bhāsitaṃ abhinanditvā anumoditvā yena so brahmā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā taṃ brahmānaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then that member of Brahmā’s retinue, having approved and agreed with what Mahāmoggallāna said, went to that Brahmā and said to him,
“Good sir, Venerable Mahāmoggallāna said this:
‘There are many disciples of the Buddha
who have the three knowledges,
and have attained psychic power, expert in reading minds,
they’re perfected ones with defilements ended.’”
That’s what that member of Brahmā’s retinue said.

segments.pli: Attamano ca so brahmā tassa brahmapārisajjassa bhāsitaṃ abhinandīti.
segments.en: Satisfied, that Brahmā was happy with what the member of his retinue said.

suttaplex.blurb: An unnamed brahmā god thinks to himself that he is so powerful no asctic can approach him. The Buddha goes straight to his realm and appears wrapped in flame above his head. Mahāmoggallāna and several other disciples follow him. The brahmā and his retinue are sutiably impressed.
